title: Do different rule violations stack punishment tiers?
body: If i get a 14 day ban for intentionally feeding, then after the ban is over I decide to flame for the first time,will i get chat restricted or perma banned?

replies.body:
February 22nd 2018, 9:45:01 pm
Hey there,

No problem! I can say they are separate tracks for penalties. One does not influence another. In your example they would receive a 2 week ban for intentional feeding/trolling if they got off of a 2 week ban for toxicity.

Hope that clears things up for you.

The 0rphan
Riot Games Player Support
Morgana Support

That said, bear in mind that if you use zero-tolerance language, such as death threats and slurs, you will immediately be perma-banned. 
It is also possible that if you do flame someone and they take it directly to support, the human agent could also bump you up to perma-ban, even if it's for a different offense.
Ah, that clears things up. Thank you.

I was under the impressions there is behavior related punishment (griefing, toxicity, IFS, etc)

And leaving/afk related punishment via Leaverbuster.

I know those don't stack, but I thought all behavior related punishments stack.

Also, I don't know where botting/cheating/scripting falls into it. (i.e. if you get a 2-week ban for boosting, I don't know if saying a zero-tolerance phrase nets you a permaban or not).

Good luck in your search. I'd like to know.

I have heard recently that they are separate, but what I understood was that being punished for gameplay reasons skipped you tiers, which leads me to believe that they aren't.

Basically, I don't know. Why would you pick now to flame somebody though? Just don't do that and you will be good.
im not sure but i think perma
